info.title: VictorOps API
info.description:
This API allows you to interact with the VictorOps platform in various ways. Your account may be limited
to a total number of API calls per month. Also, some of these API calls have rate limits.

NOTE: In this documentation when creating a sample curl request (clicking the TRY IT OUT! button), in some API
viewing interfaces, the '@' in an email address may be encoded. Please note that the REST endpoints will not
process the encoded version. Make sure that the encoded character '%40' is changed to its unencoded form before
submitting the curl request.

post.description:
Add a user to your organization

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

get.description:
Get a list of users for your organization

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

get.description:
Get the information for the specified user

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

put.description:
Update the designated user

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

delete.description:
Remove a user from your organization. If no replacement is specified, an empty JSON payload ("{}") is still required.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

get.summary: A list of shift changes for a team
get.description:
Returns a log of user shift changes for the specified team. This is historical
data, and may be up to 15 minutes behind real-time log data.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Return shift changes occurring after this timestamp. The default is the start of the day at midnight. Specify the timestamp in ISO8601 format

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Return shift changes occurring before this timestamp. The default is the end of the day at 11:59:59. Specify the timestamp in ISO8601 format

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: The VictorOps user ID. Return shift changes occurring during the interval specified for this user. Without this parameter, all relevant users (with respect to the specified interval) are returned

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

patch.description:
__NOTE: This API call is deprecated. Please use `PATCH /api-public/v2/policies/{policy}/oncall/user`__

Replaces a currently on-call user on the team with another.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

patch.description:
Replaces a currently on-call user in the escalation policy with another.  In many cases, the policy slug
will match the slug of the team that contains it.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

get.description:
Get a list of the currently open, acknowledged and recently resolved incidents.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

post.description: Create a new incident. This call replicates the function of our manual incident creation process. Monitoring tools and custom integrations should be configured using our REST Endpoint. This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

patch.summary: Acknowledge an incident or list of incidents
patch.description:
The incident(s) must be currently open.  The user supplied must be a valid VictorOps user and a member of your organization.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

post.summary: Reroute one or more incidents to one or more new routable destinations.
post.description:
Reroute one or more incidents to one or more users and/or escalation policies

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

patch.summary: Resolve an incident or list of incidents
patch.description:
The incident(s) must be currently open.  The user supplied must be a valid VictorOps user and a member of your organization.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

patch.summary: Acknowledge all incidents for which a user was paged.
patch.description:
The incident(s) must be currently open.  The user supplied must be a valid VictorOps user and a member of your organization.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

patch.summary: Resolve all incidents for which a user was paged.
patch.description:
The incident(s) must be currently open.  The user supplied must be a valid VictorOps user and a member of your organization.

This API may be called a maximum of 60 times per minute.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

get.description:
__NOTE: This call is deprecated. Please use `GET /api-reporting/v2/incidents`.__

Retrieve incident history for your company, searching over date ranges and with filtering options.  This is historical
data, and may be up to 15 minutes behind real-time incident data.  By default, only resolved incidents will be returned.

This API may be called a maximum of once a minute.

Incident requests are paginated with a offset and limit query string parameters.
  The query for incidents is run and offset

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The entity ID involved  This is the unique identifier for the entity causing the incident.

parameters.name: incidentNumber
parameters.description: The incident number as shown in VictorOps Multiple values and ranges are allowed: 4,5,20:50

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description: Return incidents started after this timestamp Specify the timestamp in ISO8601 format

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description: Find incidents started before this timestamp  Specify the timestamp in ISO8601 format

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: The host involved in the incident Multiple values can be separated with commas.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The service involved in the incident (if any) Multiple values can be separated with commas.

parameters.name: currentPhase
parameters.description: The current phase of the incident "resolved", "triggered" or "acknowledged". Multiple values can be separated with commas.

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

get.description:
Retrieve incident history for your company, searching over date ranges and with filtering options.

This API may be called a maximum of once a minute.

Incident requests are paginated with a offset and limit query string parameters.
  The query for incidents is run and offset records are skipped, after which limit records will be returned.

The default offset is 0 and the default limit is 20. The maximum value allowed for limit is 100.

Unless specified otherwise with the parameter currentPhase,

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The entity ID involved  This is the unique identifier for the entity causing the incident.

parameters.name: incidentNumber
parameters.description: The incident number as shown in VictorOps Multiple values and ranges are allowed: 4,5,20:50

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description: Return incidents started after this timestamp Specify the timestamp in ISO8601 format

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description: Find incidents started before this timestamp  Specify the timestamp in ISO8601 format

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: The host involved in the incident Multiple values can be separated with commas.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The service involved in the incident (if any) Multiple values can be separated with commas.

parameters.name: currentPhase
parameters.description: The current phase of the incident "resolved", "triggered" or "acknowledged". Multiple values can be separated with commas.

parameters.name: routingKey
parameters.description: The original routing of the incident

200.description: Some details about the user that was added

orig.description: The user scheduled on call (if any)

over.description: The user overriding the scheduled on call user (if any)

start.description: The time the override is scheduled to start

end.description: The time the override is scheduled to end

change.description: The time the period is scheduled to start

until.description: The time the period is scheduled to end

oncall.description: The user scheduled on call (if any)
The user scheduled on call (if any)

overrideoncall.description: The user overriding the scheduled on call user (if any)

currentPhase.description: The current phase of the incident "resolved", "triggered" or "acknowledged".

alertCount.description: The number of alerts received for this incident

lastAlertTime.description: The time of the last alert received for the incident

lastAlertId.description: The unique id of the last alert for the incident

host.description: The host on which the incident occurred

service.description: The service name causing the incident (if any)

pagedUsers.description: The users that were paged for the incident.

pagedTeams.description: The teams that were paged for the incident

pagedPolicies.description: The escalation policies that were triggered for the incident

transitions.description: Transitions of the incident state over time

by.description: The user that caused the transition (if any)

manually.description: If the incident transition was caused by a person

alertId.description: The unique alert ID that caused the transition

alertUrl.description: A URL to retrieve the details of the alert that caused the transition

offset.description: The offset passed in the request

limit.description: The limit value passed in the request

total.description: The total number of incidents available for this search

currentPhase.description: The current phase of the incident "resolved", "triggered" or "acknowledged".

alertCount.description: The number of alerts received for this incident

lastAlertTime.description: The time of the last alert received for the incident

lastAlertId.description: The unique id of the last alert for the incident

ackUserId.description: The VictorOps user id of the user that acknowledged the incident

ackTime.description: The time of the last acknowledgment of the incident

host.description: The host on which the incident occurred

service.description: The service name causing the incident (if any)

AckUser.description: A JSON object with first/last name and email of the user that acknowledged the incident.

entityType.description: The type of entity causing the incident (host/service)

entityDispName.description: The display name of the entity causing the incident

teams.description: The teams that were paged for the incident (comma separated).

messageType.description: The type of alert; INFO, WARNING, ACKNOWLEDGEMENT, CRITICAL, RECOVERY

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the alert in seconds since epoch.

stateStartTime.description: The time this entity entered its current state (seconds since epoch).

stateMessage.description: Any additional status information from the alert item.

monitoringTool.description: The name of the monitoring system software (eg. nagios, icinga, sensu, etc.)

entityDisplayName.description: Used within VictorOps to display a human-readable name for the entity.

ackMsg.description: A user entered comment for the acknowledgment.

ackAuthor.description: The user that acknowledged the incident.

raw.description: The full, raw alert details JSON string (i.e. parse the string into a JSON object)

verified.description: Whether or not this user has set their password (will always be false)
Whether or not this user has set their password (will always be false)

expirationHours.description: The validity duration for the invitatation/set password link sent to the added user.

replacement.description: The user to take the place of the deleted user in escalations
The user to take the place of the deleted user in escalations

names.description: Routing keys that maintenance mode state covers. An empty list indicates global maintenance mode

instanceId.description: external friendly unique id for maintenance mode

startedBy.description: username of the user that started maintenance mode

startedAt.description: millis from epoch marking the start time

isGlobal.description: whether this instance is a global maintenance mode or for specific routing keys
